text: his news conference today Barack Obama
had two things he wanted to talk about
health care in the attempt to turn
around the faltering American economy
but there was one thing he had to talk
about the remarkable scandal surrounding
illinois governor rod blagojevich and
what prosecutors say was his attempt to
auction off his appointment to the
senate seat Barack Obama has vacated in
favor of the presidency I was as
appalled and disappointed as anybody by
the revelations earlier this week I have
never spoken to the Governor on this
subject I am confident that no
representatives of mine would have any
part of any deals related to this seat
this Senate seat does not belong to any
politician to trade it belongs to the
people of Illinois and they deserve the
best possible representation they also
deserve to know that any vacancy will be
filled in an appropriate way so that
whoever is sent to Washington is going
to be fighting for the people of
Illinois Obama announced his selection
of former Senate Majority Leader Tom
Daschle as both health and human
services secretary and coordinator of
health policy throughout his
administration that's an attempt to
streamline decision-making and avoid
some of the pitfalls the doomed health
care reform in Bill Clinton's
administration Obama repeated his view
that dramatically expanding coverage
while expensive is something America
can't afford not to do for the health of
the middle class and of the business
community Obama also tried to use his
pre inaugural popularity to press for
action in Congress on aid for the
troubled auto industry though a 14
billion dollar loan package has cleared
the house it faces strong Republican
resistance in the Senate doing nothing
Obama said would quote lead to a
devastating ripple effect throughout our
economy as I have said repeatedly I
believe our government should provide
short-term assistance to the auto
industry to avoid a collapse while
holding the companies accountable and
protecting taxpayer interests the
legislation in Congress right now is an
important step in that direction and I'm
hopeful that a final agreement can be
reached
this week what Obama new reporters
questions would be dominated by the
scandal in Illinois and they were he
repeated his call for governor
Blagojevich to resign and said he had
never discussed the Senate appointment
with the governor he expressed
confidence that no one on his staff had
been involved in any deal making the
same time he said he was still gathering
facts about contacts between his aides
in the governor's office and pledged to
lay them out when he has them even if
all those contacts support the idea that
team Obama wasn't dealing as the
governor's own wiretapped conversations
suggests that will keep this story and
unwelcome intrusion on his transition
alive for a while longer I'm John
Harwood chief Washington correspondent
for CNBC
